required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Telmisartan in Mild to Moderate Hypertensive Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Open-label Study of the Efficacy and Safety of Telmisartan in Mild to Moderate Hypertensive Patients

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the efficacy and tolerability of telmisartan, given once a day to patients with mild to moderate hypertension, as well as to assess the 24-hour blood pressure profile with ABPM

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in systolic blood pressure (SBP) and diastolic blood pressure (DBP)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 12 weeks after start of treatment
primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure values were obtained 24 hours after the last dose (through values) at the office

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of treatment response for SBP/DBP (in %)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 12 weeks after start of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Response categories: SBP < 140 mm Hg or DBP < 90 mm Hg or BP reduction â‰¥ 10 mm Hg

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in blood pressure values
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, up to 12 weeks after start of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Analysis performed for the ambulatory blood pressure monitoring (ABPM) - subgroup

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse events
Number of patients with clinically significant changes in laboratory values
Number of patients with clinically significant changes in ECG

arm_group.description: 4 week placebo run-in phase followed by 6 weeks of treatment with low dose of telmisartan
After 6 weeks of treatment with low dose of telmisartan, titration to high dose of telmisartan if blood pressure level is higher than 140/90 mm Hg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with blood pressure levels of 140/90 mm Hg or higher (confirmed on 2 consecutive visits), who were 18 years old and older, regardless of sex
Exclusion Criteria:
- Suspected or known diagnosis of arterial hypertension with a secondary cause
- Women who were not using an effective method of contraception, or who were pregnant, or breast-feeding
- Systolic blood pressure > 200 mm Hg or diastolic blood pressure > 115 mm Hg
- Laboratory test values two fold above the upper normal limit
- Previous intolerance to angiotensin conversion enzyme inhibitors or angiotensin II blocker (AIIAR)
- New York Heart Association class III or IV heart failure
- History of stroke in the 6 months prior to entry into the study
- Uncontrolled type 2 diabetes mellitus, defined as fasting glucose levels > 140 mg/dL on 3 consecutive assessments
- Patients who were included in another investigational drug study in the past 30 days
